page.title: 09ASHILL CHURCH OF ENGLAND
page.content: The 700 year old St Nicholas Church is undergoing its first major alteration for a century. The Mediaeval Chancel screen has been extended to fill the arch, and the whole glazed, to make the chancel a separate Meeting room, with the old vestry as a kitchen. The communion table has been brought forward in front of the screen on to a new platform in the Nave, together with the original communion rails, which are removable, to make space for mimes, plays, guitar & recorder groups etc, at the monthly Family Service. Congregations now average 30-40 and 100-160 at special Family Services. About 30 boys and girls up to 11+ attend Sunday School, about 15 up to 14+ go to Pathfinder Bible Class, and half a dozen older teenagers belong to Acorns group. The Annual budget is Â£7,000 incl.
